isis.stitle: AFC 00907 - Allison Transmission Upshifting Complaints in International 1652, 3400, 3800, and 4700 Models with T 444E Engine Codes 12NNA, 12NNB, 12NNC, 12NND, 12NNE, 12NNH, 12NNJ, and 12NNK Built Between August 1, 2000 and August 7, 2000

afc.subject: Allison Transmission Upshifting Complaints in International 1652, 3400, 3800, and 4700 Models with T 444E Engine Codes 12NNA, 12NNB, 12NNC, 12NND, 12NNE, 12NNH, 12NNJ, and 12NNK Built Between August 1, 2000 and August 7, 2000

geninfo.para: The vehicles described above may exhibit poor transmission upshifting. To correct this issue, the engine ECM must be re-programmed.

svcproc.title: SERVICE PROCEDURE

note.para: When performing the service procedure in this AFC letter, you must click on the box marked "Check if replacing module on the vehicle" to insure that the latest information is available for your vehicle.

To perform this procedure, the EZ-Tech service tool must be used. The ECM cannot be re-programmed without the EZ-Tech service tool. To acquire this tool, contact Mr. Joe Hamilton at International Truck and Engine Corporation phone number 630-691-5428.

important.para: Record the Customer Parameters before programming the ECM. The Customer Parameters may change after the ECM is re-programmed and may need to be changed back to the settings the vehicle had when it arrived in the shop.

svcproc.para: Re-program the ECM using the EZ-Tech service tool and NETS 2.0 software. Follow the instructions attached to this letter.

step1.para: Open the Vehicle Diagnostics folder on desktop and select Navistar NETS ( Figure 1).

The following window appears when the Navistar Nets icon is selected ( Figure 2). Notice that two different services are available with NETS, each one of the options can be selected by clicking on the appropriate button.

para.emph: For AFC 00-907 you MUST use the Navistar NETS side to process the information.

figure.caption: Figure 2. This Window Appears When Navistar NETS Icon is Selected

step1.para: If only NETS is required, click on "Navistar NETS". Notice that when NETS is selected a Navistar NETS window appears ( Figure 3). If an AFC window appears instead you are not in the window for normal programming, you must then go back to the main screen and select the "Navistar NETS" button. Make sure you are doing the process that you want. If you do service using NETS, any AFC changes will automatically be applied during this process; so you do not have to do an extra process.
Navistar NETS includes 4 steps:

step2.para: GET: Retrieves the data from the truck. This stage takes place at the truck with no need to have a phone line available.

SEND: During this step the data retrieved from the truck is sent via modem to Navistar. In order to perform this operation you must be connected to your phone or DCN II line so data can be transmitted. There is no need to be connected to the truck during this process.

RECEIVE: Once the files containing the truck and engine data have been transmitted to Navistar the system will update the information for the latest calibration. During the RECEIVE step, these files containing the new information are electronically transmitted back to the EZ-Tech.

PROGRAM: The last step takes place back at the truck where the files containing the new engine or truck data are transmitted back to the engine ECM. Same as the GET process this stage takes place at the truck with no need to have a phone line available.

important.para: On vehicles equipped with Allison electronic transmissions, and ABS brakes, all of the ECUs MUST BE DISCONNECTED prior to beginning any reprogramming operation using NETS or Navistar AFC. Please refer to the "Table of Contents" for details on how to disconnect the transmission.

For the reprogramming operation to be successful the instructions provided on the screen and this manual must be strictly followed at all times. Always verify that all connections are solid and make sure that the key is in the right position according to the instructions.

para.emph: Make sure that the right COM port is selected when performing the GET and the PROGRAM steps. Refer to CONNECTING THE EZ TECH TO THE VEHICLE in the Table of Contents

step1.para: Click on the "Get Data" button to start the GET process, the following window will appear:
Enter the eight-digit VIN number.
Click on the box marked (Check if replacing module on the vehicle)
Enter the correct Mileage, Hours, and Fuel used.
Click the OK button.
Click Get Data and the following window appears:
Verify that the ignition key is in the ON position and click OK:

figure.caption: Figure 6. Turn Key Off and Then Back On

step1.para: Turn the key off and then back on. Even if the ignition key was ON prior to this step, IT MUST BE TURNED OFF AND BACK ON. Once you have done this click OK.
The next window appears; it reads data from the ECM module. Please Wait.

note.para: If the message "Engine controller is not responding" appears on the screen, make sure cable is in correct COM port, that the power is ON, and all electronic auxiliary equipment is disconnected. After verifying this try again.

step1.para: The following screen is then obtained: Click OK to complete the GET process.
Click the close button.
In order to perform this step you MUST have the following:

item.para: A dedicated Phone line or DCN II network connection
The modem card must be installed to the EZ-Tech. If the modem card is not installed the computer must be shut off before the card can be installed.
The Modem adapter must be connected to the modem card and the phone line. There is no need to be connected to the truck to perform the SEND process.
Also make sure that you have a user ID (DYYxxxx) and a valid password so you can access the Navistar DCN II.

step1.para: Click on the "Send Data" button to start the SEND process, the following window will appear:

Click the desired chassis or Select All. Then click "Send Data". You can also select multiple VINs by holding the "Ctrl" key while clicking on the desired ones. Once you click on the "SEND DATA" button the EZ-Tech will initiate the connection with Navistar.

Select modem (phone) or Direct DCN II network connection. If using phone, make sure that your cable and lines are connected to modem. Type your login user id for DCN II NET'S (Navistar System 21 Support Group Supplied) and hit the ENTER key.

Once connected the EZ-tech will start sending the selected file(s) to Navistar. The EZ-Tech will send one file per VIN selected and will display a message indicating the number of files that were successfully sent ( Figure 10). Please verify that the number of files successfully sent matches the amount of VINs previously selected. Click OK and then close the "Send data" window to continue with the process. LEAVE THE EZ-TECH CONNECTED TO NAVISTAR if you are replacing an Engine Module.

para.emph: For this process the system will automatically process the parameters and in about 5 to 10 minutes you can do the Receive Process

step1.para: Click on the "Receive" button at the main NETS window to start the RECEIVE process, the following window will appear:

Click the desired chassis or Select All. Then click "Receive". You can also select multiple VINs by holding the "Ctrl" key while clicking on the desired ones. Once you click on the "RECEIVE" button the EZ-Tech will initiate the transmission of files back to the EZ-Tech.

note.para: You can only select the VINs that you last SENT to Navistar. Only these will be Received. If you request to receive a chassis that was not Sent originally, the EZ-Tech will display a message saying that the data for this chassis was not found.

step1.para: The transmission of the files will start as soon as the RECEIVE button is selected.

note.para: If you are still connected to the network the program will not request you to connect again, however if the connection is not present, you will be requested to repeat the connection steps described on the SEND instructions.

step1.para: The screen will display the number of successfully received files. Two files will be received for each received VIN. Due to different file sizes, some files might take longer than others to transmit.
Click the OK and select the Close button on the Receive window to complete the operation.

svcsubproc.title: Step 4 PROGRAM

step1.para: Back at the vehicle, use the cigarette lighter power adapter or your 120 volt power supply for power during programming, connect the EZ-Tech to the ATA connector and assure the appropriate COM port is selected.
Turn the ignition Key ON. Remember to carefully follow the Key ON / Key OFF directions since this is very critical for a successful programming.
Click on the "Program" button at the main NETS window to start the Programming process, the following window will appear:
Select the desired VIN from the list and click on the PROGRAM button. A message will be displayed asking you to confirm the VIN.
Please verify that the VIN to be programmed matches the vehicle and click the "YES" button.
Read the instructions and click Next.
Make sure that the ignition key is turned ON and click Next.

svcsubproc.para: REMEMBER: on vehicles equipped with Allison electronic transmissions, and ABS brakes, all of the ECUs MUST BE DISCONNECTED prior to beginning any reprogramming operation using NETS or Navistar AFC. Please refer to the "Table of Contents" for details on how to disconnect the transmission.

important.para: For the reprogramming operation to be successful the instructions provided on the screen and this manual must be strictly followed at all times. Always verify that all connections are solid and make sure that the key is in the right position according to the instructions.

step1.para:
Verify that the EZ-Tech is connected to the truck through the appropriate COM port and the ignition key is in the ON position
and click Next. This action will initiate the first stage on the programming.

figure.caption: Figure 17. First Stage on the Programming

para.emph: DO NOT WALK AWAY FROM VEHICLE DURING NEXT STEP

step1.para: During this stage of programming the EZ-Tech will program all the parameters and calibrations into the ECM. This process will take approximately 10 minutes.
After completing the step one of programming you will get a message indicating that the ignition key must be turned OFF and then back ON.

para.emph: IT IS VERY IMPORTANT FOR THE INTEGRITY OF THE PROCESS THAT THE KEY IS TURNED OFF AND THEN BACK ON. NOT PERFORMING THIS STEP WILL INDUCE A PROGRAMMING FAILURE TO THE MODULE.

figure.caption: Figure 18. Turn Key Off and Back On

step1.para: Turn the ignition key OFF (leave OFF for 3 seconds) and then back ON before you click on the Next button.

Once you click on the Next button, the second stage of programming will take place. This stage is much faster than the first one, it only lasts a few seconds. After this second step is completed you will get a message stating " Engine Programming Completed Successfully"
Click OK once you get this message. This will prompt a second message stating, Engine programming was successful. At this point you must turn the key OFF so the program can be stored on the module.

para.emph: IT IS VERY CRITICAL THAT YOU TURN KEY OFF AT THIS TIME. NOT PERFORMING THIS STEP WILL INDUCE A PROGRAMMING FAILURE TO THE MODULE.

step1.para: After turning the key OFF you can click on the Finish button and then click Close on the program window. Programming is complete. Nice Job !

laborinfo.para: Operation number must appear on all claims.

claims.para: Expense is to be charged to Warranty. Claims are to be submitted in the normal manner, making reference to Authorized Field Change Number G-00907.

It is important that the coding be completed properly to assist in processing the warranty claim. Complete instructions will be found in the Warranty Manual, Section 7-1. Special attention should be given to Items 39 through 44.

To assure this important improvement is made in a timely manner, all claims for G-00907 activity must be submitted by November 30, 2001 or within the normal warranty period for the vehicle, if after November 30, 2001.
